title: Cho Gath ate me 6 times and now I can't kill him, Nerf.
body:
I can only assume this must be the thought process of the the people insisting cho Gath is OP. 

Yes if you feed him he turns into the tank from hell and if he gets all his stacks he is huge. 

Luckily we have {{item:3153}}, imagine that, a %hp item excels vs a guy that stacks HP. 

Stop just always crying for nerfs and buffs to tailor the game to you because you refuse to adapt to certain champions and certain metas.

Im not saying you have to play the meta and you don't have to adapt, but don't bitch like you're owed nerfs or buffs.

replies.body: This is why people hate LCS lol. If you see your favorite champion played in LCS, your first reaction is probably "FUCK! Now I gotta learn a new champion"
Actually I like to get some professional material on how to play my favourire champs. It's annoying though when they take the support I wanted to learn to a solo lane...

Imagine how us {{champion:111}} junglers felt when he was drafted by C9... and then taken support.

~~I say that but I mostly play him support now since I'm tired of being counter jungled~~

I've been doing Naut support for about a year now.  I'm not saying that to brag or sound hipster, it's just the truth.  I used to get so much crap for doing it ("Pick a real support", "Naut doesn't bring anything special bot", "He's weak, pick someone like Morg or Thresh", etc.) but I had a lot of fun and won more games than I lost with it.  

Then everything changed when the pros did it.  I remember getting super excited watching that first game with Naut support, and going "YES!  I was right!  Now I won't get made fun of for doing this!"  I got the opposite.  "Ugh, another meta sheep."  "No, don't pick Naut just because he was in LCS." and from the enemy team:  "Naut OP, needs nerf."  "Hate how people copy every OP thing in LCS."  

It's impossible to win in this scenario.  >_<

No, naut did used to be shit. He's only being able to be played as a support thanks to buffs to him/ nerfs to others. Along with the whole tank meta.  Naut was a shit support, you did nothing innovating. The recent buffs to him allow him to be played as support/jungler.

Just because it works better now than it did before doesn't mean he didn't find success with it, or that he wasn't trying something new. It's not like Nautilus' entire kit was reworked. Don't be a dick.

A p{{item:3010}} proc and a full unload of all abilities on a single champ that equal 6+ something seconds of screwed up. Ive always went support Naut! I shake my head when a meta troll chooses to not do a single thing when I got this guy locked up for eternity >.>

Urgot was essentially the only champ I played between levels 8 and 25, when team builder turned me back into a support main. He is still my top laner of choice, and I really worry about getting crap about that. I was excited when they gave his shield mana scaling, but I never imagined that he would show up in the LCS and become popular in high levels of play. I just really hope he doesn't get nerfed for it.

I also really hope Nautilus does not get nerfed too bad, since he has long been my primary jungler. I'll just have to keep working on my Quinn jungle, just in case. I think she's pretty nerf-proof!

Yeah, Urgot's a lot of fun.  I'm not great with him, but I like how he can deal with melee champions, so he's been one of my go-to champions when I need to fight assassins.  I've gone top and mid with him, but prefer mid just because of the relative safety of the shorter lane.  Also, things there are generally squishier there than in top, and it's easier for Urgot to deal with them.  

My 'main' champion is Viktor.  I love pretty much everything about him and have been playing him for about as long as I've been playing League.  Seeing him show up in LCS, followed by Nautilus and Urgot got me excited, but I'm also fearing nerfs.  All three of them are well-balanced, if not underpowered (especially in Urgot's case), but I've seen threads calling for them to be nerfed.  Before being played in LCS no one really cared about them.  Now that they've become 'meta' people are jumping on the "It was in LCS, so it MUST be OP!" train, and calling for nerfs on champions that don't need them.  I have faith that Riot won't go overboard, but I know that champions are not always safe from being nerfed into oblivion.  Urgot has already had it happen once, he does not need it again...

that feeling when I saw {{champion:45}} picked in a big LCS match a while back (I think it was actually one of those college thingies actually) and they take him support.

"YES! YESYESYESYESYESYESYESYE....you little piece of crap."

{{champion:8}} and {{champion:50}}  --> Blew my mind. I had just started using them a lot this year, then a few months in, one's picked first in ranked games....then one's banned. I was just like "WHAT!?

> [{quoted}](name=GuiltyGecko,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Kf9m8tpM,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2015-04-21T15:21:51.907+0000)

Good thing riven isn't played :) or Jaycee
Wasn't Jayce a common pick last season?
His popularity died out after all of his W changes, so he is okay to use right now.
But that w change wasn't anything. He's still the same beast ass monster he was last season. People just don't play him mid where he truly shines.
{{champion:6}}

I thought I would be safe with Cho'Gath for so long.

But the  LCS ruins everything I love. Lulu, Annie, Gragas, now i'm waiting for Cho to get to the chopping block.

I dont understand what goes on in peoples heads sometimes. I read a thread by a plat 1 saying Darius is op and needs a nerf....next thing you know Garen will be on the chopping block...you know, for Demacia
Dunks are op and lead to players feeling humiliated and no one should have to feel embarrassed or inferior because thats like bullying. Nerf Garen and Darius
I should build Blade of the Ruin King on Syndra mid then.
wtf else would you build
It wouldn't be your job as Syndra to deal with that, if you really need it get Liandry's since that does %hp dmg.

People forget Cho'gath's classic weakness:

He's big and easy to CC, AND he's got 0 mobility

I'd hope someone like that gets to do tons of damage if he builds tons of damage

What if he does

#PunsOfDamage{{item:3078}} 

Now that's OP

(You can get my sarcasm hopefully :)

Yeah, no, Cho is pretty broken, and has been for a while. He's going to get nerfed soon. 
Rupture is pretty easy to land, and it guarantees a silence will land... and with his R that's pretty much a 100-0 kill.

Oh yeah, just the other day I was playing garen top and I walked by a bush and it was the damndest thing, cho just ate me. I was full health but that dang ulti just 100-0d me.

Gtfo

Yes, if you play a squishy champion top lane, you're going to die to cho, the king of weak true damage.

However, if you play a squishy champion top lane, you die to ANY meta top laner. 
Talking about you, {{champion:24}} {{champion:14}} {{champion:39}} {{champion:111}} 

Maybe it's not the champion, it's your garbage ideals that conflict with the meta.

Pick someone like {{champion:14}} , and watch and laugh as Cho is useless and lane and becomes nonfactor by 10 minutes.

I don't even play top lane. All this is wasted. Cho is tearing mid lane up right now. I didn't read past your first line, also Cho is getting nerfed, regardless of what we say on this forum. lol

You keep insisting on that like you have proof of these nerfs. However the PBE has been inactive since around the 14th, and there were no cho nerfs in the 4/14 update.. Care to share with the class? Or are you just throwing around opinions and assumptions as fact for the jollies?

Except Cho'gath is excelling in the MID lane right now. Where squishy champions traditionally go (your mages and assassins). 

Not sure what the problem is with him though (I don't think he's OP) - but I guess if your ping is even remotely high perhaps he lands rupture a lot more and then you're doomed... If Rupture is a little too reliable then they may just need to delay it a fraction of a second more.
that or maybe better servers. it's very annoying to lose several games in a row because 300+ ping :S (generaly speaking, not just about cho)

LOL
That scenario is just downright Darius XD
yah whats so op about doing 800 true dmg in 1 shot and have lots of cc/dmg/hp

No mobility, all cc unreliable, has a hard time chasing. Easily kited. Not all that tanky unless fed or ignored, which you should know not to do against cho'gath. He's incredibly strong at the things he can do but there are a _lot_ of things he can't. It's a pretty balanced design, if you ask me.
Come to think of it, I once had a friend tell me that playing Cho'gath is "Like playing a walking Mejai's". Treat him appropriately.

I want 8/0 as Cho this morning, against a Ziggs top. His jungler yelled at him for not helping when he engaged, but I was stacking MR like mad.
Dear enemy Udyr, please understand that Ziggs does not hurt me. You didn't bring the right champion or items into this lane, lol.

Some of the champs that people bitch about just are shocking.

In a game defined by mobility, a champ with delay on all of his abilities is now OP, after I recall reading for months (maybe even years) that due to said mobility he was "unplayable."

Do the complainers have any self-respect at all?  There's some champs that I just can't fathom a long-time player would whine over.
"Rock is OP, paper is fine." -Scissors

Woa i just got here. 
People saying Cho is OP are either unexperienced or simply seek to cause a commotion, just like this thread is about.

Either way, i'll let you guys to your things. Good day to you.
Hehe, I got baited in by the title seeming like a QQ thread. Well done.

As a person who plays Cho'gath, I feel he's an incredibly safe pick.

You get some pretty powerful early harass with his W, and you can kill almost any opposing laner at 6 any time you land a rupture (unless they're an incredible super tank like Sion).

There's a few people who give Cho'gath a lot of trouble in those early levels pre-6, and almost all of those people he can turn around and just suddenly kill with his level 6 burst.  Even fewer still are the champions (Sion) who can both give him trouble AND not worry too much about his burst - and against those people Cho'gath can farm pretty safely with his good waveclear, and become an awesome tanky dude with a lot of damage for teamfights.

Is he overpowered?  I don't know - I feel like he just always wins lane and becomes a monster every game, but I also feel there are way worse champions to have to play against (Vi).

Just my two (lowly) cents.

the problem with cho is he is extremely uninteractive. he ruptures? cool, you can dash out of it. or, he silences you beforehand, you eat the rupture, he walks up to you and then ults you.

i'm at the point now I just ban him out of games because he pretty much is unkillable in lane due to his sustain, gets very tanky through feast stacks and building RoA alone and just isn't fun to play against.
Also unless you get a gank he pretty much sustains everything up.
You must be very delicious to get eaten by Cho'Gath 6 times.

I'm a Cho main so I'm a little biased here, I don't think he's OP. For most champs, how good they are depends on how good the player is with that champ. I consider myself a good Cho player, not a master of course I still have much to learn, but I still have trouble with certain champs. {{champion:157}} and {{champion:150}} are probably the champs I have the most trouble with due to their ability to jump out of Rupture. For anyone actually having trouble with Cho, best thing I can recommend is watch for Rupture's cloud before it hits or just stand near the edge of it cause a bug Riot seems to ignore is that standing on the outer edges of Rupture has no effect on you. Don't let him get super fed either. If you see an enemy Cho on a killing spree, shut him down quickly. You don't want that monster in team fights otherwise.
Stop feeding Cho'Gath.

i just wish ppl would stop their constant bitching about this meta its the best its ever been for a long time and if ppl cant use their brains to build according to situations than they shouldn't have the right to complain but we all know this wont happen since ppl are gonna find a way to bitch one way or another but still good post op

yeah all these adc's switching back to IE+PD build like its season 1 again when you have a fucking percentage damage item LOL
it's so dumb.
I don't see anyone getting IE+ blade or just blade+ IE anymore.

It's like people stopped caring that tanks exist despite cinderhulk making tanks viable finally somewhere in the game.
